title: Ramayana
author: Valmiki
description: An ancient Indian epic narrating the journey of Prince Rama to rescue his wife Sita from the demon king Ravana.

title: Mahabharata
author: Vyasa
description: One of the two major Sanskrit epics of ancient India, detailing the Kurukshetra War and the fates of the Kaurava and the Pandava princes.

title: Bhagavad Gita
author: Vyasa
description: A 700-verse Hindu scripture that is part of the Indian epic Mahabharata, presented as a dialogue between prince Arjuna and the god Krishna.

title: Panchatantra
author: Vishnu Sharma
description: An ancient Indian collection of interrelated animal fables in Sanskrit verse and prose.

title: Arthashastra
author: Chanakya
description: An ancient Indian Sanskrit treatise on statecraft, economic policy, and military strategy.

title: Rigveda
author: Unknown
description: An ancient Indian collection of Vedic Sanskrit hymns, one of the four canonical sacred texts of Hinduism known as the Vedas.

title: Upanishads
author: Various
description: A collection of ancient Sanskrit texts that contain some of the central philosophical concepts and ideas of Hinduism.

title: Manusmriti
author: Manu
description: An ancient legal text among the many Dharmasastras of Hinduism.

title: Ramcharitmanas
author: Tulsidas
description: An epic poem in the Awadhi dialect of Hindi, retelling the story of the Ramayana.

title: Gitanjali
author: Rabindranath Tagore
description: A collection of poems by the Bengali poet, for which he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1913.

title: Man's Search for Meaning
author: Viktor Frankl
description: A 1946 book by Viktor Frankl, chronicling his experiences as a Holocaust survivor and describing his psychotherapeutic method of finding meaning in all forms of existence.
